jcr:content.jcr:title: Just a Poet with a Soul

contentheadline.headline: Just a Poet with a Soul

contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Just a Poet With Soul | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[Def Jef]] | Cover = Just a Poet with a Soul.jpg | Released = 1989 | Recorded = 1988 - 1989 | Genre = [[Hip hop music|Hip hop]] | Length = 51:25 | Label = [[Delicious Vinyl]] | Producer = | Last album = | This album = '''''Just a Poet With Soul'''''<br /> (1989) | Next album = '''''[[Soul Food (Def Jef album)|Soul Food]]<br />(1991) }} {{Album ratings|noprose=yes |rev1=[[Allmusic]] |rev1score={{Rating|4.5|5}} [{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r27765|pure_url=yes}} link] }} '''''Just a Poet With Soul''''' is the debut [[alternative hip hop]] album by [[Def Jef]], released in 1989 (see [[1989 in music]]), released on [[Delicious Vinyl]]. The album was highly praised upon its first release, with critics enjoying the sociopolitical lyrics that have led some to Def Jef along with [[De La Soul]] and other members of the [[Native Tongues Posse]], though he was never a part of the crew. Many have called the album a lost classic of hip hop. ==Track listing== #"Droppin' Rhymes on Drums" (with [[Etta James]]) #"Givin' Em Rhythm" #"On the Real Tip" #"Poet With Soul" #"Give It Here" #"Do You Wanna Get Housed" #"Black to the Future" #"Do It Baby" #"God Made Me Funky" #"Downtown" #"Just A Poet" ==Samples== '''Droppin' Rhymes on Drums''' *"Blow Your Whistle" by [[The Soul Searchers]] '''Givin'em Rhythm''' *"Love Rap" by [[Spoonie Gee]] and [[The Treacherous Three]] *"Rebel Without a Pause" by [[Public Enemy (group)|Public Enemy]] '''On the Real Tip''' *"Get Up, Get Into It, Get Involved" by [[James Brown]] *"[[Got to Be Real]]" by [[Cheryl Lynn]] *"Sing Sing" by Gaz '''Poet With Soul''' *"Apache" by [[Incredible Bongo Band]] '''Give It Here''' *"I Gotcha" by [[Joe Tex]] *"Bra" by [[Cymande]] *"Have Your Ass Home by 11:00" by [[Richard Pryor]] *"Dance With Me" by [[Peter Brown (singer)|Peter Brown]] *"Holy Ghost" by [[Bar-Kays]] *"[[Give It to Me Baby]]" by [[Rick James]] '''Do You Wanna Get Housed''' *"Party" by [[Van McCoy]] '''Black to the Future''' *"The Ballot or the Bullet" by [[Malcolm X]] *"[[Synthetic Substitution]]" by [[Melvin Bliss]] *"Hot Dawgit" by [[Ramsey Lewis]] *"[[Fly Like an Eagle (song)|Fly Like an Eagle]]" by [[Steve Miller Band]] *"UFO" by [[ESG (band)|ESG]] '''Do It Baby''' *"Action Speaks Louder Than Words" by [[Chocolate Milk (band)|Chocolate Milk]] '''Just a Poet''' *"Hit or Miss" by [[Bo Diddley]] *"Mighty Fine" by Peter Jacques Band {{DEFAULTSORT:Just A Poet With A Soul}} [[Category:Delicious Vinyl albums]] [[Category:Def Jef albums]] [[Category:1989 albums]]
